etymologies: late 19th century: from phospho-‘relating to phosphorus’ + -ine, on the pattern of amine

definitions: a colorless foul-smelling gaseous compound of phosphorus and hydrogen, analogous to ammonia, widely used as an insecticidal fumigant in agricultural products.

notes.text: Chemical formula: PH₃. It forms salts containing the phosphonium ion, PH₄⁺

shortDefinitions: colourless foul-smelling gaseous compound of phosphorus and hydrogen
